definition: to pass on scripture/to teach Confucian doctrine/to pass on one's experience
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: Have someone taken part in the CET oral English Test , could you please give us some advise?
sentences.chinese: 有没有参加过四级口语考试的前辈给咱们传传经呀？

sentences.english: They have come to us to pass on their valuable experience.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我们传经送宝来了。

sentences.english: Finished lectures for the next day , Chuan-by Xunzi stresses of work and then return.
sentences.chinese: 讲毕，作次日讲义，讲荀子传经之功，遂归。

definition: to pass on doctrines from master to disciple (Buddhism)
to lecture on doctrine/to expound the wisdom of ancient sages/to preach/a sermon
to explain a sutra/to expound the classics
Xuanzang (602-664), Tang dynasty Buddhist monk and translator who traveled to India 629-645
(Buddhism) to initiate sb for monkhood or nunhood
tathagata (Buddha's name for himself, having many layers of meaning - Sanskrit: thus gone, having been Brahman, gone to the absolute etc)
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
